comments.commentBody: This fails to recognize that City Opera was an important venue for many works of contemporary opera in the mid-century and was a success: Blitzstein's Regina; Beeson's Lizzie Borden; Menotti's The Old Maid and the Thief; Britten's Albert Herring; Moore's Carry Nation...the list goes on and on. Musical reactionaryism wouldn't have fixed NYCO's problems.

I don't agree. Students on their own must learn money management, cleaning/organizing, time management, and laundry habits as well as all the tasks related to school itself. Phone calls and texts from parents cannot accomplish this maturation process.

The problem is not old, rich people who need a Kickstarter.  They give lots already, and will stop giving the moment they die.  Young, rich people, of whom there happen to be plenty around, not only in the San Francisco Bay Area - it is these people that can easily spend a mere 7 million but who appear not to be interested in culture in its broader sense at all.  We have a billionaire here who left more than 60,000 people (attending a huge annual conference from all over the world and the country) waiting to speak to them, and who did not bother to show up because he wanted to spend time following his sail boat racing on the water.  So much for "culture", to name only one example (admittedly, older than other young billionaires here).  NYCO may well be a sign of things to come.  Maybe "old Europe" is then the place to go after all....?

I suggest you go to Germany, which has many opera houses with nudity and without, as you call it, "the fat lady at the end" - you might love it so much that you would consider emigrating to Europe :-)

Boito's Mefistofele with Norman Treigle - I was too young, and lived too far away (Holland) to hear it live at NYCO in 1969.  I am happy, however, to own the recording, though, with Norman Treigle, and the London Symphony under Julius Rudel.  Would that it could have been a recording with the NYCO forces, though.  New York without NYCO is as lesser New York.  Sad for the city, and a shame for America as a whole.  NYCO disappears - and meanwhile we get regaled about the  dresses at the Emmy's, another Kim Kardashian nonevent, the breakup of George Zimmerman's marriage, and Beyonce and Miley shaking their bottoms, and, lest we forget, the latest Dow Jones and Nasdaq numbers.  We are amusing ourselves to death, as Neil Postman aptly observes in his book "Amusing ourselves to Death.  Public Discourse in the Age of Showbusiness".  With the loss of NYCO, we have lost an important contributor to the public discourse in this country.

The fact that no one is willing to step up with a donation tells more about the state of the country, and indeed of western capitalist society as a whole, than about Bloomberg's NYC.  A society in which people and culture are reduced to mere economic commodities which are expendable will end up as totalitarian.  This is about much more than the failing of NYCO - we likely will live the days that reveal the extent of a cultural demise that may be frightening.  I hope it will not come to this.

@ Practicalities - When I was in college, I wanted nothing more than to find my own doctor! But like most college students, I was still on my parents' health insurance plan, which only covered doctor visits in their state, a 15 hour drive away. When I finally got my own insurance, it took me years to find a doctor who was taking new patients in my area. I was holding on to all my physical medical files from my pediatrician for years!

A lot of America outside the Beltway and the two coasts don't work for the government our its elitist lackeys - Wall St, military contractors, media, policy organizations, progressive not-for-profits, cultural institutions - to name just a few. None of these parasitic organizations - worthy as some may be - have suffered during the downturn. They all are amply reward from the direct or indirect connection to government. So, of course they will all fight tooth and nail for the continued maintenance of the Federal government.

Know It All, I'm afraid there are some things you don't know.  My career involved working closely with many non-profit organizations, and I can tell you they suffered badly during the economic downturn.  Donations from individuals plummeted.  Private foundations have much less money to give to nonprofits in a recession because the value of their investments drops.  Cultural institutions also suffered terribly.  Not only do donations drop, but audiences dwindle.  I have no idea why you think that cultural institutions and progressive not-for-profit organizations are all amply rewarded by government.  It just ain't true.

Many congressional Republicans are living in an America where reality is dictated by Fox and talk radio furor, with Obama as the constant foil.

Problem is, most of the rest of us have lives and jobs. OUR reality is that we mostly just don't want politicians to screw them up too much.

As I watched the mishandling of the after-effects of hurricane Katrina, I came to the conclusion that the elite contained people who actually wanted Black citizens and poor Whites to die. When I raised this possibility with other Nova Scotians they agreed.

It's a pity that racism prevents Black Americans and poor Whites from getting together to resist the oppression of both by the elite.

"the sick to die..."

Actually, no. They want the poor to keep spending and consuming. They want the chronically ill to keep going to the ER, and the healthy middle class to pick up the tab thru higher hospital costs and premiums. They want gays back in the closet, still working and paying taxes but without rights or protection. And don't mistake them, they WANT Hispanics here illegally, in low-wage jobs with no organizing leverage, to sustain their crackhead economy. They want us to distrust government, instead of our real exploiters, and brown people with accents instead of slick-talking suits like Romney and Dimon.

They think they can capitalize on hatred of Obama, to get us to vote in a House and Senate that will abolish the EPA, neutralize the FDA, tie the hands of the SEC and bank regulators, and hand the country over to the drillers, the frackers, the payday lenders and the gene splicers. They'll give us casinos and Frankenfood, cigarettes and soda, and their bankster backers will loan us the money and make a profit both ways.

Exploiters need victims, Jerry.

How do we know any 'liberals' who are for all the things these Tea Party types are against, aren't really against them, and just keep voting for the party that keeps doing exactly what they really don't want them to do, but what they pretend they want them to do.  And they do this to keep in favor with those they so much really fear, whom they hope to placate and appease, while being traitors to their fellow Americans who still hope for an America that stands for its true principles? For then all the people who really stand for all the 'liitle people' who dutifully pay their taxes and obey the laws, and even have some decency left, are being left in the lurch, and this is quite alright for these liberals who live in their gated communities and can afford to pay for the best lawyers to serve their most dishonest causes.

The G.O.P. not only wants smaller government, they want smaller governed. They’d like the sick to die, the poor to starve, the Hispanics deported, the blacks locked up, the disabled kept out of sight, and gays to disappear through sexual reorientation.

Because after all, people who aren’t like them aren’t real Americans, right? And if you aren’t a real American what good are you, and why even waste time passing laws that might prolong the annoying existence of you?

The analogy is well-chosen, but you mixed metaphors in your comment. It is not only the Pequod/Congress that the Ahab/Republicans are sinking, but the Pequod/America, and I don't know if there will be an Ishmael to tell the tale.
And thank you Nan, for a wonderful analysis, and paraphrasing Charles Blows wonderful column.

Dear Charles Blow - you sound like Ishmael in Moby-Dick.  All collapsed for Captain Ahab whose destructive obsession and monomania for the White Whale carried him to his death and his ship, the Pequod -rammed by the whale- sank as well with all hands save Ishmael.  The Pequod was Melville's metaphor for America.  The House of Representatives is full of Ahabs whose only goal in life is to remove President Obama (in this case - the White Whale) from office.  And so in our time, 2013, the dread-full and magnificent tale of Ahab and his demented pursuit of Moby-Dick is being relived in the Republicans insane obduracy against President Obama.  The Congress, like the Pequod, is sinking, and only Ishmael will live to tell the tale. Thank you for your brilliant column at this seminal time in our history.

I hope you are right since it would then expose what a true sham our pretenses of an elected representative government has become over the past decades.

An imperial president, an unelected and unaccountable judiciary, a rubber stamp legislature - all the hallmarks of Rome in its dying days.
I agree.  It's time to end this insanity, and this is the best way to take this gun out of the hands of the lunatics.

I hope Obama invokes the 14th amendment and stops the madness.  It's the only responsible thing to do, considering the treasonous, hostage-taking behavior of the plutocrats' mad-dog, lap-dog Republican servants in Congress.

I think the President has a new strategy that he is not revealing. I think that just before the Government hits the debt ceiling, he will go to the Supreme Court and ask that they rule that under section 4 of the 14th amendment, he is obligated to pay the debts that Congress has caused the country to incur.  I think the Roberts Court will have to rule in favor of the President's petition because otherwise, he would be in violation of the amendment's prohibition against questioning the debt of the United States.

I say "conservatism" is the mantel under which the uneducated, provincials, the narrow-minded and the fearful hide under. It's a form of keeping your head in the sand when you can't think for yourself.

They continually undermine this president why? Because they have absolutely
nothing to offer..

(Cue the eerie background music)

I also thought of solving it as a cryptoquote, with the empty squares being an E, L or S. Can't understand why I didn't think of "Eloi may flee".

I still don't get it - how does the 3x5 box match the 2x4 braille alphabet? Which rows and columns do you leave out? By trying to guess which proper braille letter to use, I came up with, "Melee L Kove" - close, but absolutely no cigar.

Larry G,

In each "Letterbox", the 2nd Row and Column, and the 4th Row, are just separators to make the rest more readable.

That leaves you with 3 Rows and 2 columns in each dark-lined rectangle.

This matches the 3x2 Braille arrangement.

This befuddled me for the longest time; see the blog comments from the blog where the solution was revealed for more detail (that was Sept. 24).

Two things threw me in solving the message:

The first, as several people mentioned, was the incongruence of the 3x5 puzzle boxes and the 2x3 Braille format.

The second is more odd. When I first saw the puzzle grid, the scattered single black squares reminded me of Braille dots. Honest. (I'm frequently in State-owned buildings, where all the elevators and doors have Braille number signs.) Thought I was home free when the "READ THIS..." message filled in, had the Braille page all ready to go. The trouble was, three of the boxes had no single black squares in them! It took the longest time to get over my original idea...Finally, 'CONNECT THE DOTS' sank in...DOTS, DOTS...round...O...Oh!

And there it was.

Honestly, yes, I believe that hatred for the president is the core of their fight.
Their are enough racists (their hatred is because he is black for the most part) in their base and it has allowed them to pretend and to posture and to be absurd...

They should all be impeached for "high crimes and misdemeanors" e.g. failure to carry out their constitutional duties to govern.

They are advocating nothing more nor less than a dictatorship based on a theocracy and we have seen how well that works in the middle east.

Our democracy is in danger here.

It could well be. Hatred knows no boundaries and can be
Very irrational! lt can lead to the distruction of self and country. Don't foget Natzism.
Is hate for the prez more than their love for the well being of this country? We shall see....
You included "racists"...... more commenters should do that.

Don't  be so optimistic, William. At the rate we are going, Americans are giving away their rights and are headed for a new order, The Democratic Republic of the United States. That will be a fancy name for serfdom and a new feudalism, with large corporations becoming lords of the manor.
First we must change the method of redistricting the states so they are fair and evenly divided.

Sorry, but this isn't about issues, it isn't about the debt ceiling, nor Obamacare or any other piece of legislature.. It's all about the Republican Party and the fact that it has been hijacked by what was first believed to be a lunatic fringe, the Tea Party.

Way back when, both parties fought over the means, but both honestly had the Country's best interests at heart. This mindset always leads to a compromise that serves the interests of the citizenry. It slows progress but doesn't stop it in it's tracks.

The non-Tea-Party Republicans must regain control of their Party if it is to survive. Until then, racists, single issue constituencies and all kind of demagogues will continue to hold America hostage and wreak havoc on it's people. They wont succeed in destroying the Country, it is too strong for that, but it won't be for want of trying.

Despite all the highly intense political debates, this is democracy at work; it's not pretty and rarely expedient but what we are witnessing is what the founders intended. Ultimately the power is inherent in the people and the people will prevail , however it not be clear until 2014 or 2016. Please stand by. We all make choices and can live here, or find another country more in line with your values, beliefs an convictions.
They did not have their propaganda network of FOX at that time. They now have a propaganda network that can rival Tokyo Rose with their propaganda.

Rene, Michigan

Despite all the highly intense political debates, this is democracy at work

****
Americans are coming to terms with the limits of the positional power of a US president. Naturally, those that voted for him would like to believe that winning an election entitled him to more.

Turns out the real strength of a president doesn't reside in his position.

The last time the Republicans actually carried through on their threat to shut down the government, when Bill Clinton was President, they got blamed for the disruption that ensued. Unless the public is much less informed than then (a possibility?), the Republicans will get blamed again. As for the debt ceiling "crisis," not just the U.S. public, but the rest of the world will put the blame where it belongs, squarely on the shoulders of the Republicans.

I only hope that President Obama hangs tough this time and refuses to "compromise."

Canada, with a population of just under 35,000,000, is way too small of a market for the drug companies to bother trying to control the entire health care system.

Plus, people born there, except perhaps Ted Cruz, don't normally go all crazy over anything, except maybe hockey.

The tenacity that you two had to make your marriage work, reminds me of the  tenacity that my husband and I had to make our marriage work... I could feel the "Blood, Sweat, and Tears" throughout your story... But you MADE it! Congratulations! May you have many more happy and blessed years.

Correction:
They are continuing their long march to fascism.
What you should be stating is that the Republicans are the apostates since they don't kneel to the theocracy of the Progressive Church.

They are continuing their long march to theocracy. This is just another skirmish along the way to them where they win just by forcing the dialogue further right even if theyntheynlose the legislative battle.

The Dominionist Caucus in the House andSenate have stymied progress on any initiative for five years and are content to play out the clock until 2016 as they build their apparatus and amass funds.
Based on the famous story "It's a GOOD Life" (1953) by Jerome Bixby.  Give credit where it's due!

All I know is, I feel like that Twilight Zone family with the little kid who has awful globe-controlling powers,and they all have to go around saying "It's a GOOD day.  It's a very GOOD day" all the time.  If they don't,  the kid turns them into awful things and buries them in a cornfield.
Great! Maybe you and Larry Eisenberg should consider a limerick  'pas de deux'.

A Congress of fools,
Run by Tea Party rules,
Pushing on the brakes,
To increase the citizens' aches,
And dumber than a pack of mules.

Congress, our "national nutcase", Gail? Yes, and our national shame and their insane behavior (cf Ted Cruz and green eggs and ham) has made the US the laughingstock of the world.  Representatives mouthing off that President Obama's Affordable Care Act is the worst act to be passed in all of American history!   The Tea Party's, Conservative Republican visious need to impeach President Obama for treason.  Yes, Congress is cracking up and hasn't far to go.  They are now stuck between a rock and a hard place and will make their decision sometime in the next couple of days whether to kick the can down the road or show President Obama who's boss.   The demented inmates (mirabile dictu - elected to their high office) are running the asylum and are on their runaway train, heading to wreck the gravy train that is the US Congress, and dragging us along behind them.
If the government shuts down, John Boehner should go back to tending bar. He'd be far more productive passing drinks than passing laws.

It's planet Earth, The USA and Washington DC. The bucks are flowing, the party members are partying. Everyone is having a good time. Why not? You wanna 172.5 K gig plus expenses? You wanna get ballyhooed and wooed? Just take a side, any side; rant, rave and get elected!

Do you really think any of those Tea drinkers really want to stop the disco, turn off the fountain of Gelt? It's 90% theatre! It gets one reelected and a trip back to the big bucks ball!

Americans will copy their southern neighbors and move north, to the land of milk and honey, Canada.

Unfortunately, Canada will not be able to accommodate the tide of Yankees coming across its unguarded southern border.

The hostage takers are increasing their demands. Their appetite for power grows the more it feeds. (to paraphrase Shakespeare.)

We are horrified by foreign dictators unleashing destructive weapons 'on their own citizens". But American gop radicals are unleashing economic Terrorism 'on their own citizens'. So if we don't stop it, we will need a welcoming country to take in our poor, huddled economic refugee masses, yearning for basic economic security. This is like a mafia type shakedown enterprise. But it uses our Constitution to dominate the 3 branches, hiding behind pious slogans of not spending beyond our means. And to top it off, they want everybody armed with guns.
